She currently has a business selling beauty products; a business she started six years ago on her own initiative.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy cosmetics from distributors and then resell them on order.  This was of working allows her to generate income for her family since she’s married and has two children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health services and the training sessions.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: Roxana tiene 20 años y vive junto a su esposo y su pequeño hijo en una casa construida  a base de adobe. Roxana se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 5 años junto a su esposo en una parcela de 1 hectárea donde tiene plantaciones de cacao y café orgánico.Roxana considera que esta actividad es una buena fuente de ingresos para su familia ya que puede solventar los gastos que se le presentan. Cuando llega la temporada de cosecha contrata algunos trabajadores del lugar que le ayudan a recolectar las mazorcas de cacao para luego secarlos y venderlos en la ciudad. Roxana tiene planeado reemplazar varios árboles cacaoteros que ya no pueden dar frutos razón por la cual debe comprar plantas de almácigo y contratar trabajadores del lugar para que realicen el reemplazo de manera uniforme. Este es el primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para salir adelante con su actividad laboral. En esta ocasión desea contar con 500 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico y así nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Roxana is 20 years old and lives with her husband and their small son in an adobe house. 

Roxana has been working in agriculture for 5 years with her husband on a hectare plot where she has cocoa and organic coffee. Roxana thinks this work is a good source of income for her family as she can cover the household expenses that come up. When the harvest season comes she hires workers to help harvest the cocoa pods and later they are dried and sold in the city.

Roxana has plans to replace some cocoa trees that no longer can bear fruit so she needs to buy nursery plants and hire workers to replace them in a standardized manner.

This is her first Kiva loan and she is grateful for the financial support in order to move forward with her work. At this time she is requesting 500 soles in order to buy organic fertilizer to nourish her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Barbra

texts.en: Barbra is a single mother of four children, one in school. She also takes care of four grandchildren. She sells green bananas and has been in this business for eight years. She has applied for a loan of 600000 Uganda shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. She generates additional income from a small retail shop. She works from home seven days a week and sells on retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality, thieves and defaulters. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to build rental rooms. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and utilities.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine is married with one child who doesn’t go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (sisters). She owns a retail shop and has been in this business for one year. She has applied for a loan of 500000 Uganda shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, cooking oil, rice and maize flour. She works in a shop that she rents seven days a week and sells on retail basis only. She doesn’t have any other income generating activity. Her major business challenges include transportation of commodities from Kampala city to her shop and also the ever increasing price of commodities In Uganda. She is aspiring to own a fully stocked retail shop and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees for her sisters.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, cooking oil, rice and maize flour.

loans.name: Proyección Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PROYECCIÓN”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Basilia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de zapatos, venta de gorras, venta de víveres, repostería, pulpería y venta de CD’s.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Basilia es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de calzados; este negocio lo emprendió hace un año por recomendación de sus amigas.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de calzados) que adquirirá de las empresas distribuidoras y posteriormente lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para su familia ya que ella es casada y tiene hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan la atención en salud.
texts.en:
The Proyección” (Projection) communal bank will start the first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board presided over by Basilia.  The members of the communal bank carry out a variety of businesses among which are: neighborhood store, shoe sales, cap sales, grocery sales, pastries, groceries and CD sales.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen like Basilia.  She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer two years go having joined thanks to an invitation from a girlfriend who is a member of the institution.  She currently has a business selling shoes that she started a year ago on the recommendation of her girlfriends.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy shoes from suppliers and then resell them on order.  This way of working allows her to generate family resources since she’s married and has children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health services.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Rosas De Belen Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS DE BELEN” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Virginia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: taller de costura, venta de verduras, venta de polleras, tejido de mantas, taller de costura, venta de salchipapas, venta de ropa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Virginia es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de  una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por recomendación de una amiga, hace varios años atrás.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa) que adquirirá, por mayor, de las ferias de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en las comunidades del departamento de La paz. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones del área de salud.
texts.en:
The “Rosas de Belén” (Bethlehem Roses) communal bank will start the sixth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board presided over by Virginia.  The communal bank members are in a variety of businesses among which are: tailor shop, vegetable sales, skirt sales, blanket weaving, tailor shop, ‘salchipapas’ [fried sausages with fried potatoes] sales and clothing sales.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen like Virginia. She indicates that she’s been a member of Pro Mujer for three years having joined thanks to an invitation from an institution’s promoter who visited her at home.  She currently has a business selling clothes and she makes it known that she started it on a girlfriend’s recommendation several years ago.

The loan she’ll take out is to increase capital.  She will buy clothes at wholesale in street markets in the city of La Paz and then resell them in communities in La Paz Department.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her home since she’s married and has three children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health training.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: After graduating junior high school, Mercy decided to set up her own business selling banku. (Banku is a traditional Ghanaian dish made using fermented corn/cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth whitish consistent paste). She prepares her banku on her own and proceeds to sell it in Hohoe. With over 17 years worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited by a lack of funds. As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more maize and cassava, thus enabling her to prepare and sell more of her tasty banku. She aims at using the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a petty trader) with the upkeep of their house while ensuring that their five children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to help her purchase more maize and cassava, thus enabling her to prepare and sell more of her tasty banku.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels so she can sell greater quantities of groceries and palm oil

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is a small-scale fish seller in Hohoe. She has had some form of formal education as she is a junior high school graduate. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a mason. Veronica has been working as a fish seller for close to 4 years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans to use her loan to purchase an increased quantity of fish so she can meet rising customer demand. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of buying a fish stand so she can sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of fish so she can meet rising customer demand

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en: Although he grew up in difficult circumstances, Innocent is an entrepreneur. He specializes in selling groceries in Hohoe. He has been involved in this enterprise for 15 years. Innocent is single without any children. The proceeds from his business normally go towards helping him support himself and his extended family. Innocent wants to use his loan to increase his current inventory levels, hence allowing him to sell greater quantities of groceries. In the long term, Innocent plans to reinvest future profits into his business so he can expand and meet rising customer demand.

loans.use: to increase his current inventory levels

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia tiene 39 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos en una casa construida a base de adobe.Su principal fuente de ingreso es la agricultura y desde que empezó a dedicarse al campo recibe el apoyo de su esposo con quien realiza las distintas actividades para la producción de cacao y café orgánico.Virginia posee una parcela de 2 hectáreas  donde tiene varios árboles de cacao y trata de mantenerlos en buen estado con abono orgánico y retirando la maleza que crece constantemente.
Para la cosecha contrata a trabajadores del lugar a quienes paga por adelantado y le ayudan a recolectar los frutos maduros para  posteriormente secarlos y venderlos a los centros de acopio de su zona.Uno de sus principales objetivos a largo plazo  es comprar otra parcela para ampliar su producción de cacao y mejorar sus ingresos.Este es el tercer préstamo con KIVA y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante. En está ocasión desea contar con 2,000  nuevos soles para comprar plantas de almácigo y reemplazar los árboles de cacao desfasados.
texts.en:
Virginia is 39 years old. She lives with her husband and 3 children in an adobe house.

Her main source of income is agriculture and since she began working in the field she has received the support of her husband who performs various activities for the production of cocoa and organic coffee.

Virginia has a 2 hectare plot where she has several cocoa trees and she tries to keep them in good condition with organic fertilizer and by removing the weeds that constantly grow. She hires workers for the harvest and pays them an advance fee to help gather the mature fruit so they can be dried later and then sold at the collection centers in her area.

One of her main long-term goals is to buy another plot in order to expand her production of cocoa and increase her income.

This is her third loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support so she can get ahead. At this time she is requesting 2,000 soles in order to buy nursery plants to replace the outdated cocoa trees.

loans.use: to buy nursery plants to replace outdated trees

loans.name: Torre Fuerte Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “TORRE FUERTE” iniciará el vigésimo segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Victoria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de ropa, consultorio dental, venta de zapatos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Victoria es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de  una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de zapatos; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió con el apoyo de su esposo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cuero) que adquirirá, por mayor, de las tiendas de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente al elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The “Torre Fuerte” (Strong Tower) communal bank will start the 22nd cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Focal Center.  It has nine members led by a governing board presided over by Victoria.  The communal bank members are in a variety of businesses among which are: food sales, clothing sales, dental clinic and shoe sales.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen like Victoria.  She states that she’s been a member of Pro Mujer for three years having joined thanks to an invitation from a girlfriend who is a member of the institution.  She currently has a business selling shoes and lets it be known that she started it with her husband’s support.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy leather at wholesale in stores in La Paz and after manufacture will sell in her sales space.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her home since she’s married and has three children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health area.

loans.use: to buy leather.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his current inventory levels so he can sell greater quantities of plantains and avocados.

loans.name: Los Cedrales Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado  Los cedrales está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde tres de las señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con un ingreso insuficiente, estas mujeres en especial están poniendo todo de si para crecer.
Maria es una de estas mujeres, que por medio de la venta de cosméticos quiere ir superando su pobreza, y dándole a su familia lo que ellos necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones. Ella se define a si misma como una persona muy hábil para las ventas y es por eso que ya tiene una muy buena clientela.
Solicita este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de cosméticos de marca y tener asi buena variedad con la que podrá impresionar a sus clientes. Ella agradece por esta oportunidad que ella y su familia están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The "Los Cedrales" group is participating in the Survey for Poverty Elimination, where 3 of the women are below the poverty line (in other words, they have insufficient income).  These women, in particular, are giving their all so they can grow.

Maria is one of these women.  By selling cosmetics, she wants to overcome poverty and give her family all that they need to have a life without wants.  She defines herself as being very good at selling and it is for this reason that she has many customers.

She is asking for this loan to be able to buy name-brand cosmetics.  By so doing, she will have a good variety that will impress her customers.  She is grateful for this opportunity that her and her family are receiving.

loans.use: buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Zapatito Veloz Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ZAPATITO VELOZ”  iniciará el décimo tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Gregoria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de repuestos de cocina, venta de gelatina, venta de papas fritas, producción de chicharrones, venta de bañadores, producción de vasos, tapicería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Gregoria es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una comadre que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; este negocio lo emprendió hace un año por recomendación de su hermana.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de horno industrial) que adquirirá de las empresas distribuidoras y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de comercialización. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para su familia ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la atención en salud.
texts.en:
Zapatito Veloz Communal Bank will start its thirteenth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani Regional Office.  It's made up of eight members governed by a board of directors of which Gregoria is the president.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses, including selling stove parts, selling gelatin, selling fried potatoes, making cracklings, selling bathing suits, making glasses, and upholstery.

The loan they're getting will benefit small business entrepreneurs like Gregoria.  She says she has been a member of Pro Mujer for five years, having joined on the invitation of a close friend who's a member of the institution.  Currently she has a business selling food, which she started a year ago on the recommendation of her sister.

The loan she's currently getting is to increase her capital by buying an industrial oven, which she'll acquire from the distribution companies and later set up in her food stall.  This form of work allows her to generate resources for her family, because she's married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she says the attention to health.

loans.use: to buy an industrial oven

loans.name: Alpaquitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ALPAQUITAS”  iniciará el décimo noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ruth es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, tienda de barrio, venta de coca, venta de papel sábana y periódico, producción de carteras, venta de fruta, venta de focos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ruth es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de artículos según la temporada; este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia al observar que existe un sinfín de necesidades del público.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra estandartes) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y en la actualidad está estudiando.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y el área de salud.
texts.en:
The “Alpaquitas” (Little Alpacas) communal bank will start the 19th cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board presided over by Ruth.  The communal bank members are in a variety of businesses among which are: food sales, neighborhood store, coca leaf sales, paper towel and newspaper sales, purse manufacturing, fruit sales and light bulb sales.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen like Ruth.  She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer 8 years ago thanks to an invitation from a girlfriend who is a member of the institution.  She currently sells seasonal products, a business she started on her own initiative seeing that the public has unending needs.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy banners in street markets in the city of El Alto and then resell them in her sales space.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her home since she’s single and currently studying.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the credit and the health area.

loans.use: to buy banners.

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es:
La  Sra.  Zoraida  está casada con el Sr. Miguel, ellos tienen 3 hijos mayores que ya están casados, y por quienes ella y su marido han luchado siempre.
La señora tiene una despensa bien surtida y de buena ubicación ya que es la única despensa en los alrededores. Ella se inició hace varios años con muy pocos productos, que poco a poco fue aumentando con el pasar de los años. Hoy día ella tiene una despensa bien surtida y buenos precios, con una clientela formada.
Ademas su marido es una persona muy trabajadora y con su trabajo ayuda con los gastos del hogar, el actualmente está trabajando como constructor de obras. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable a sus compromisos.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de bebidas, verduras, frutas, carnes, y demás insumos para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Zoraida is married to Miguel and they have 3 children who are grown and married.  She and her husband have always worked hard for their sake.  She has a well-stocked pantry where she sells her goods.  She is in great location because it is the only business of its kind in the area.  When she started several years ago, she had very few goods, but little by little she has been increasing her supply over the years.  Now she has a well-stocked store at good prices and an established clientele.

In addition, her husband is very hardworking and with his work helps with the household expenses.  He is currently working in construction.  Zoraida is very hardworking and always keeps her promises.

She is asking for this loan so she can buy drinks, vegetables, fruit, meat, and other goods.  In this way, she can continue selling like she has been doing.

loans.use: buy drinks, vegetables, fruit, meat, and other goods.

loans.name: Maranatha Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MARANATHA”  iniciará el décimo tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Adela es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, tienda de lubricantes, venta de ropa interior, venta de zapatos, pensión, venta de cereales.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Adela es integrante, ella indica que hace diez años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una asesora de la institución que fue a su casa a visitarla. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa; este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia utilizando los ahorros que tenía su familia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y el compartimiento con sus compañeras.
texts.en:
The “Maranatha” communal bank will start the 13th cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board presided over by Adela.  The communal bank members are in a variety of businesses among which are: clothing sales, lubricants store, underwear sales, shoe sales, meal sales and cereals sales.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen like Adela.  She indicates that she’s been a member of Pro Mujer for ten years having joined thanks to an invitation from one of the institution’s advisers that visited her at home.  She currently has a business selling clothes that she started on her own initiative using family savings.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy clothes from wholesalers in the city of El Alto and then will sell them in her sales space.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her home since she’s married and has five children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the credit and sharing with her fellow members.
.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Flor De Selva Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE SELVA”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Delia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: costura de polleras, comerciante de frutas, encuadernación, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Delia es integrante, ella indica que hace un año y medio que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una asesora de la institución que fue a su casa a visitarla. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de fruta; este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa de su madre, ya que le ayudaba en la comercialización de este producto, posteriormente decide establecer un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de fruta) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y el compartimiento con sus compañeras.
texts.en:
The “Flor de Selva” (Jungle Flower) communal bank will start the second cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board presided over by Delia.  The communal bank members are in a variety of businesses among which are: skirt sewing, fruit sales, book binding and food sales.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen like Delia.  She indicates that she’s been in Pro Mujer for a year and a half having joined thanks to an invitation from one of the institution’s advisers that came to visit her at home.  She currently has a business selling fruit, a business she started on her mother’s initiative since she helped her sell said product.  Later on she decided to start her own business.

The loan she’ll take out is to increase capital.  She will buy fruit from wholesalers in the city of El Alto and then resell it in her sales space.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her home since she’s single and has two children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the credit and sharing with her fellow members.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 56  años, su esposa es Irene,  tienen 2 hijos,  es de la ciudad  de Paraguarí,  ambos luchan por sus hijos para poder darles todo lo que necesitan y que no tengan que pasar por necesidades.
Pedro tiene un taller de autos, donde día a día trabaja, buscando mejorar su vida y la de su familia. El es una persona muy trabajadora y sacrificada, que con el apoyo de su esposa también está creciendo y ambos se complementan.
Pretende utilizar el crédito para la compra de herramientas para el taller  ya que de esta manera podrá aumentar y obtener un mayor ingreso. Agradece por la oportunidad que estan recibiendo el y su esposa.
texts.en:
Pedro is 56 years old and is from the city of Paraguarí.  Irene is his wife and they have 2 children.  They struggle so their children have everything they need and don't have to go without.

Pedro has an auto repair shop where he works every day to try to improve his and his family's lives.  He is very hardworking and sacrifices much.  With the help of his wife, they are growing and complementing each other.

He hopes to use his loan to buy tools for his shop, since in this way he can increase and improve his income.  He is thankful for this opportunity that he and his wife are receiving.

loans.use: buy tools for his repair shop.

loans.name: Dableniton Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Dableniton sont des Hommes ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Lobougoula, un des villages de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
lls sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec Mr Danaya debout à extrême droite. 
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter les intrants et semences  pour entretenir : 3 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 300 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi a prendre en charge les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille.
texts.en:
The members of the group Dableniton are men averaging 45 years of age and four children each, all living in polygamous families in Lobougoula, a village in Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The men are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back.

The crop grown is corn, as is the case with Mr. Danaya, who is standing at the far right in the photo. With his loan, he intends to purchase the farm in puts and seeds for maintaining: 3 hectares.

After the harvest, the produce is sold in the village, at the Sikasso market, to a customer base composed of men and women. He plans on making an average profit of 300,000 francs CFA per planting. The profits will enable him to pay off his loan and also to cover his family's day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and seeds

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  Benkadi 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, 3 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Fatia, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur Sixième  prêt avec l’institution et les autres prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  la tomate et le maïs avec Djeneba debout au milieu sur la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants,  l’engrais, herbicide, semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO et environna après la récolte  elle vend à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 40 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes, à l’amelioration du regime alimentaire et subvenir au frais de santé de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 3 group are all married women. They have an average age of 36 years, and have an average of three children each. They all live in traditional families in Fatia, a village in Sikasso, the third-largest administrative region in Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution so that they can successfully continue with their businesses during the rainy season. They are on their sixth loan with the institution, and have repaid all their prior loans without incident.

The women in the group grow tomatoes and corn. Djeneba is a member, and is pictured standing in the center of the photo. With her loan she plans to buy agricultural inputs, fertilizers, herbicides and seeds, as well as to pay for the labor expenses involved in farming her 0.5 hectares of land. After the harvest, she sells her produce in a village market in Sikasso and the surrounding areas, and her customers are both male and female. 

Djeneba expects to make a profit of 40,000 francs CFA each season. These profits will allow her to make repayments on her loan, as well as to help her large family with their daily expenses, to give them access to better food, and to help with her children's health expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to pay for labor expenses.

loans.name: Kotognongontala  5 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Kotognongontala 5 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, 3 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Fachoribougou, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur Dixièmes prêt avec l’institution et les autres prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  la tomate, piment  et l’aubergine  avec   Assan    debout au milieu sur la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants,  l’engrais, herbicide et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 1hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO et environna après la récolte  elle vend à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 95.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "Kotognongontala 5" are married women averaging 30 years of age and three children each, all living in traditional families in Fachoribougou, a village in Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their tenth loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back.

The crops grown are tomatoes, chili peppers, and eggplant, as is the case with Assan, who is standing in the middle in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining 1 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold in the village, at the Sikasso market, and nearby to a customer base composed of men and women. She plans on making an average profit of 95,000 francs CFA per planting. The profits will enable her to pay off the loan and also to help her large family to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and seeds and to cover the cost of plowing and weeding

loans.name: Kotognongontala  2 Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  Kotognongontala 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans, 3 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Fachoribougou, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur Dixièmes prêt avec l’institution et les autres prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  la tomate, piment  et l’aubergine  avec     Kadia Bourama debout au milieu sur la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants,  l’engrais, herbicide et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 1hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO et environna après la récolte  elle vend à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 100.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Kotognongontala 2 group are all married women. They have an average age of 46 years, and have an average of three children each. They all live in traditional families in Fachoribougou, a village in Sikasso, the third-largest administrative region in Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution so that they can successfully continue with their businesses during the rainy season. They are on their tenth loan with the institution, and have repaid all their prior loans without incident.
 
The women in the group grow tomatoes, peppers and eggplant. Kadia Bourama is a member, and is pictured standing in the center of the photo. With her loan she plans to buy agricultural inputs, fertilizers, herbicides and seeds, as well as to pay for the labor expenses involved in farming her one hectare of land. After the harvest, she sells her produce in a village market in Sikasso and the surrounding areas, and her customers are both male and female. 

Kadia Bourama expects to make a profit of 100,000 francs CFA each season. These profits will allow her to make repayments on her loan, as well as to help her large family with their daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to pay for labor expenses and hoeing.

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  Benkadi 2  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 47 ans, 3 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Fatia, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur Sixième  prêt avec l’institution et les autres prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : la tomate et le maïs avec      Adiara   debout au milieu sur la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants,  l’engrais, herbicide, semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 1hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO et environna après la récolte  elle vend à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 85.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes, à l’amelioration du regime alimentaire et subvenir au frais de santé de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 2 group are all married women. They have an average age of 47 years, and have an average of three children each. They all live in traditional families in Fatia, a village in Sikasso, the third-largest administrative region in Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution so that they can successfully continue with their businesses during the rainy season. They are on their sixth loan with the institution, and have repaid all their prior loans without incident.
 
The women in the group grow tomatoes and corn. Adiara is a member, and is pictured standing in the center of the photo. With her loan she plans to buy agricultural inputs, fertilizers, herbicides and seeds, as well as to pay for the labor expenses involved in farming her one hectare of land. After the harvest, she sells her produce in a village market in Sikasso and the surrounding areas, and her customers are both male and female. 

Adiara expects to make a profit of 85,000 francs CFA each season. These profits will allow her to make repayments on her loan, as well as to help her large family with their daily expenses, to give them access to better food, and to help with her children's health expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to pay for labor expenses.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: Reyna tiene 50 años de edad y tiene 3 hijos quienes son personas mayores y muy trabajadores. Vive en su casa propia construida con bloques de adobe junto a su hermana y otros familiares. Se dedica a la agricultura hace 25 años. Inicialmente trabajaba al lado de su esposo y tras su separación se hizo cargo de sus hijos con el terreno agrícola que compró en aquel entonces.Gracias a la producción de algunos productos de la zona como cacao y café ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos. Le gusta mantener sus terrenos en buen estado y usa abono orgánico en sus terrenos de cultivo.Contrata mensualmente algunos trabajadores del lugar para que le ayuden a retirar la maleza de sus parcelas y evitar que consuman los nutrientes de los suelos. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante. En esta ocasión desa contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para comprar abono orgánico y nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Reyna, 50, has three hardworking adult children.  She lives with her sister and other family members in her own house made of adobe bricks.

She has made a living in agriculture for 25 years.  In the beginning she worked with her husband.  After her separation she became responsible for her children and some agricultural land she bought at the time.  Thanks to producing some local crops such as cacao and coffee she has managed to get her children ahead.

She likes to keep her land in good condition and she uses organic soil amendments on her crops.  She hires some workers in the area monthly to get rid of the weeds so they don't remove all the nutrients from the soil on her land.

This is her first loan with Kiva and she's grateful for the financial support she's receiving to get ahead.  She wants to have 1,000 nuevos soles [PEN] to buy organic soil amendments to nourish her plants.

loans.use: to buy organic soil amendments

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is married with four children and all of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (a young brother). She has a business selling used clothes. She has been in this business for five years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes .She generates additional income by hiring out her motorcycle. She works at the market six days out of every week. Her major business challenges include the rainy season, which hinders her customers from reaching her, and the ever-increasing price of used clothes.  She aspires to become a wholesaler, to start importing used clothes and to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family doesn’t have access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fee, feeding the family and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used  clothes.

loans.name: Yobana

texts.es:
Yobana tiene 23 años de edad , vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en una casa construida a base de adobe.
Hace 5 años se dedica a cultivar cacao y café orgánico y para obtener una calidad en sus productos abona el suelo de sus terrenos con abono orgánico. Para facilitar su trabajo suele contratar a trabajadores del lugar a quienes paga por adelantado y son de mucha ayuda principalmente en la cosecha. Luego de secar sus productos vende las mazorcas secas a los compradores del lugar logrando recuperar lo invertido en la cosecha. Yobana además gradece el apoyo de sus padres quienes le regalarón su  primer terreno agrícola y gracias a ello logró conseguir las cosas que tiene actualmente. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero recibido para seguir adelante. En esta ocasión desea contar con 500 nuevos soles para comprar abono orgánico y nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Yobana is 23 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in a house built with adobe. She has been working growing organic cacao and coffee for five years, and she uses organic fertilizer to fertilize her land in order to obtain quality products. 

She usually hires local workers to make her work easier. She pays them in advance and they are of great help, particularly during harvest season. After drying her products, she sells the dried beans to local buyers and manages to recover all of what she invested in her crops. 

Yobana is also grateful for her parents' support. They gave her her first plot of farmland, which allowed her to achieve what she now has. 

This is her second Kiva loan and she is grateful for the financial support she receives in order to keep going. This time she wants to have 500 nuevos soles to purchase organic fertilizer and nourish her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Kotognongontala 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  Kotognongontala 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 55 ans, 5 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Fachoribougou, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur Dixième prêt avec l’institution et les autres prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  la tomate, piment  et l’aubergine  avec Fanta   debout au milieu sur la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants,  l’engrais, herbicide et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 1hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO et environna après la récolte  elle vend à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 150.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Kotognongontala 3 group are all married women. They have an average age of 55 years, and have an average of five children each. They all live in traditional families in Fachoribougou, a village in Sikasso, the third-largest administrative region in Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution so that they can successfully continue with their businesses during the rainy season. They are on their tenth loan with the institution, and have repaid all their prior loans without incident.
 
The women in the group grow tomatoes, peppers and eggplant. Fanta is a member, and is pictured standing in the center of the photo. With her loan she plans to buy agricultural inputs, fertilizers and herbicides, as well as to pay for the labor expenses involved in farming her one hectare of land. After the harvest, she sells her produce in a village market in Sikasso and the surrounding areas, and her customers are both male and female. 

Fanta expects to make a profit of 150,000 francs CFA each season. These profits will allow her to make repayments on her loan, as well as to help her large family with their daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to pay for labor expenses and hoeing.

loans.name: Kotognongontala  4 Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  Kotognongontala 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 50 ans, 4 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Fachoribougou, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur Dixièmes prêt avec l’institution et les autres prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  la tomate, piment  et l’aubergine  avec Sali   debout au milieu sur la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants,  l’engrais, herbicide et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 1hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO et environs après la récolte  elle vend à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 50.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "Kotognongontala 4" are married women averaging 50 years of age and four children each, all living in traditional families in Fachoribougou, a village in Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their tenth loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back.

The crops grown are tomatoes, chili peppers, and eggplant, as is the case with Sali, who is standing in the middle in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase farm inputs, fertilizer, and herbicide and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining 1 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold in the village, at the Sikasso market, and nearby to a customer base composed of men and women. She plans on making an average profit of 50,000 francs CFA per planting. The profits will enable her to pay off the loan and also to help her large family to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and seeds and to cover the cost of plowing and weeding

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is married with three children, two of whom go to school. She also takes care of other family members (three orphans). She has a beauty salon and has been in this business for six years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, Vaseline, braids, and weaves. She generates additional income by renting rooms. Her major business challenges include on-and-off electricity and ever-increasing prices of cosmetics in Uganda. She sells on a wholesale basis six days per week. She aspires to own a bridal salon and a beauty school. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, utility bills, and rent for her business premises.

loans.use: buy more cream relaxers, vaseline, braids, and weaves.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.ru:
Татьяна торгует различными розничными товарами на одном из рынков Павлограда. У нее есть свой павильон, который расположен в продуктовых рядах рынка. Основные группы товаров, которые предлагает Татьяна, можно отнести к категории мелкого попутного товара, а именно, пакеты, хозяйственные сумки, крышки для консервации, закаточные ключи, химикаты, банки.
Татьяне потребовалась сумма в 22 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить пакеты, банки, крышки и другие хозтовары для консервации ягод, фруктов и овощей. Лето – сезон консервации для многих хозяек в Украине. Многие украинцы любят дачи и выращивают свои овощи на небольших земельных участках.  А потом консервируют фрукты и овощи и делают заготовки на зиму. Татьяна знает об этой украинской традиции и хочет подготовиться к насыщенному сезону и повышенному спросу.
texts.en: Tatyana sells various retail goods at one of the markets in Pavlograd.  She has her own retail outlet, located in the food rows of the market.  The main product groups that Tatyana sells can be categorized as small convenience merchandise, specifically plastic bags, heavy-duty bags, lids for canning, canning keys, chemicals and jars.  Tatyana needs a loan in the amount of 22,000 hryvnia to purchase bags, jars, lids and other household goods for canning berries, fruits and vegetables.  Summer is the season for canning for many people in Ukraine.  Many Ukrainians love dachas and grow their vegetables on small land plots, and then can fruits and vegetables to prepare for the winter.  Tatyana knows about this Ukrainian tradition and wants to get ready for the busy season and increased demand.

loans.use: purchase bags, jars, lids and other household goods for canning berries, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Irina

texts.ru:
Ирина – из Павлограда. Она занимается торговлей постельным бельем и покрывалами на местном рынке. У Ирины есть взрослый сын, он помогает ей на рынке. В зависимости от сезона Ирина меняет группы товаров под спрос на рынке. Занимается этим бизнесом она уже более 7 лет. За счет существования своего дела имеет возможность содержать всю семью. 
Ирина обратилась к КИВА за суммой в 10 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить пляжные покрывала и полотенца для летнего сезона. Со временем Ирина мечтает открыть вторую торговую точку.
texts.en: Irina is from Pavlograd.  She is involved in selling bedding and bed covers at the local market.  Irina has an adult son, who helps her at the market.  Depending on the season, Irina changes her merchandise groups according to the market demand.  She has been involved in this business for over 7 years.  She is able to provide for her family through the existence of this business.  Irina requested a loan in the amount of 10,000 hryvnia from Kiva to purchase beach blankets and towels for the summer season.  With time, Irina dreams of opening a second retail outlet.

loans.use: to purchase beach blankets and towels for the summer season

loans.name: Katherine Amada

texts.es: La cliente Katherine reside en la ciudad de La Libertad – Ecuador, hace algunos años se inscribió en una red de mujeres vendedoras de cosméticos por catálogos,   al inicio fue un poco complicado por cuanto no tenia clientes, pero a través del tiempo y después de vender los productos a sus familiares y amigos a podido tener un numero importante de clientes, actualmente Katherine    forma parte de varias redes de venta de productos por catálogos, lo que le ha permitido incrementar sus ingresos, ahora su sueño es ampliar su red de clientes.
texts.en:
Katherine lives in the city of La Libertad, Ecuador. Some years ago she joined a network of women selling cosmetics by catalog. At the beginning it was a bit difficult because she did not have customers, but in the course of time, and after selling products to her family members and friends, she is been able to aquire a significant number of customers. 

Currently Catherine is part of several networks selling products by catalog, and this has allowed her to increase her income. Now her dream is to expand her customer network.

loans.use: Sale of costume jewelry.

loans.name: Jorge Antonio

texts.es: El cliente Jorge vive en la ciudad de Libertad,  que esta ubicada en el perfil costanero del Ecuador, la actividad económica de la ciudad de su residencia mayoritariamente es el turismo y la pesca, por lo cual puede conseguir sus productos a buen precio. Don Jorge tiene 42 años, es soltero y no tiene hijos, tiene un negocio de venta de pescados y mariscos, no tiene empleados y el solo atiende a sus clientes  todos los días, la idea de realizar los prestamos en Banco D-MIRO es hacer su negocio más grande y ofrecer productos frescos  de buena calidad para tener a sus clientes contentos y satisfechos comprando pecado, mariscos variados.
texts.en:
Jorge lives in the city of Libertad, which is on the Ecuadorian coast.  The city’s business activities are centered on tourism and fishing.  Therefore, he is able to get his products at a good price.

Jorge, age 42, is single and does not have children.  He has a business selling fish and seafood.  He does not have employees, and he tends to his customers every day by himself.

The reason for the loan with Banco D-MIRO is to make his business bigger.  It is also to offer fresh, good quality products in order for his customers to be happy and satisfied buying fish and varied seafood.

loans.use: to buy fish and varied seafood.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha is married with two children and both her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She has a food stall business selling Cavendish bananas, tomatoes, mangoes, onions, oranges and cabbages. She works at the market six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to own a bigger stall and to educate her children up to university. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, utility bills and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more cavendish bananas, tomatoes, onions, mangoes, cabbages, and oranges

loans.name: Heriberta

texts.es: La Sra. Heriberta reside en la ciudad de La Libertad – Ecuador, el cliente empezó a  su negocio gracias a capital cedido por su esposo para que tuviera un dinero extra, es así como inicio con un bazar en su domicilio donde trabaja sola desde las 08:00 hasta las 21:00, se decidió a realizar un préstamo en Banco D-MIRO porque desea ampliar su local y poder ampliar su vivienda.
texts.en: Heriberta lives in the city of La Libertad, Ecuador. She began her business thanks to working capital given her by her husband, which enabled her to have some extra money. This is how she started with a shop in her home, where she works alone from 8:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. She made up her mind to undertake a loan with Banco D-Miro because she wishes to expand her shop and her home.

loans.use: To expand her shop and her home.

loans.name: Vicente Wilfrido

texts.es: La cliente Vicente reside en la ciudad de La Libertad – Ecuador, empezó a vender guineo en las mañanas dentro del mercado de la ciudad y como le fue bien se proyecto en un futuro tener su propio local, es así que actualmente después de mucho esfuerzo, dedicación y disciplina se puso su propio local, su esposa también es una microempresaria y se dedica a vender ropa, el préstamo que actualmente realizo es para comprar mas cajas de guineo ya que desea ampliar su numero de clientes.
texts.en:
Vicente lives in the city of La Libertad, Ecuador. He began selling bananas in the mornings in the city market, and as it went well, he planned to someday have his own shop. This is how currently, after great deal of effort, dedication and discipline, he set up his own shop. 

His wife also has a small business and sells clothing. The loan he is currently undertaking is to buy more crates of bananas, as he wishes to expand his number of customers.

loans.use: To buy fruit.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: La cliente María reside en la ciudad de La Libertad – Ecuador, tiene ocho años a la confección de ropa, su familia se dedicaba a esta actividad y es donde aprendió este oficio, por eso ella escogió dedicarse a este negocio, donde trabaja de lunes a domingo y realiza sola todo el proceso de producción, actualmente es capaz de realizar trajes de hombres, mujeres y niños, el objetivo del préstamo en Banco D-MIRO es adquirir telas y su sueño futuro es tener maquinas especiales como botoneras, maquinas de bordado y así mejorar su taller.
texts.en:
María lives in the city of La Libertad, Ecuador. She has been making clothing for eight years. Her family worked in this business and it is where she learned this occupation. This is why she chose to devote herself to this business, where she works from Monday to Sunday, and carries out the entire production process on her own. 

Currently she is able to make outfits for men, women, and children. The purpose of the loan at Banco D-Miro is to acquire fabric, and her dream for the future is to have special equipment such as button sewers and embroidery machines, in order to improve her workshop.

loans.use: COMPRA DE TELAS

loans.name: Silvia Veronica

texts.es: La cliente Silvia reside en la ciudad de La Libertad – Ecuador, empezó a vender ropa a credito  a su circulo de amistades y familiares, de esta manera consiguio otros clientes referidos, y es asi como empieza a conocer el comportamiento de este negocio en el que se ha mantenido varios años y actualmente tiene muchos clientes, el negocio lo atiende sola ya que su esposo es chofer. La idea de realizar el prestamo en Banco D-MIRO es comprar mas ropa de damas y caballeros.
texts.en:
Silvia lives in the city of La Libertad, Ecuador.  She began selling clothing on credit to her circle of friends and family members, and this way got other customers by referral. She is beginning to know how this business works. She has been in it for several years and currently has many customers. 

She runs the business on her own, as her husband is a driver. The purpose of undertaking a loan with Banco D-Miro is to buy more women's and men's clothing.

loans.use: To buy women's and men's clothing.

loans.name: Irina

texts.ru:
Ирина – предприниматель из Новой Каховки. Она торгует на местном рынке. Основная группа товаров под реализацию – женская джинсовая одежда: джинсовые брюки, юбки, рубашки, пиджаки и куртки. Ирина торгует этими товарами уже 19 лет. Землю арендует у администрации торгового центра. 
Ирине необходима сумма в размере 23 000 гривен для того, чтобы пополнить ассортимент новых моделей джинсов, а также, чтобы установить новые двери и решетку в бутике, в котором она работает. У Ирины – достаточный опыт торговли, товар качественный и ходовой. Она имеет постоянных клиентов и всегда устанавливает на свои товары умеренные цены.
texts.en: Irina is an entrepreneur from Novaya Kahovka. She sells women's denim clothing at a local market, including denim pants, skirts, shirts, coats and jackets. She has been selling clothing for over 19 years and rents space from the marketplace administration. Irina needs 23,000 hryvnia in order to stock  new styles of denim and to install new doors and security bars in the boutique where she works. Irene has ample retail experience and sells high-quality merchandise in popular styles. She has regular customers and always sells at reasonable prices.

loans.use: to stock new styles of denim and to install new doors and security bars in the boutique where she works

loans.name: Sergei

texts.ru:
Сергей уже на пенсии. Раньше работал шахтером. Летом Сергей занимается выращиванием ягод и овощей на огороде. Часть выращенной продукции идет на продажу, остальное - едят сами и консервируют на зиму.

Благодаря предыдущему кредиту Сергей приобрел мотоблок, чтобы обрабатывать свою землю. В этот раз Сергей проосит предоставить кредит в размере 5000 гривен на покупку газонокосилки и стиральной машины для летнего домика. Сергей посадил сад и надеется, что через пару лет сад будет давать ему прибыль.
texts.en: Sergei is already retired.  He previously worked as a miner.  Sergei is involved in growing berries and vegetables in a garden in the summer.  A portion of the grown produce goes for sale, and the rest is consumed and canned for the winter.  Thanks to the previous loan, Sergei purchased a motoblock to treat his land.  This time, Sergei is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 hryvnia to purchase a lawnmower and a washing machine for his summer house.  Sergei planted a garden and hopes that it will bring him a profit for a couple of years.

loans.use: to purchase a lawnmower and a washing machine for his summer house

loans.name: Aku

texts.en: Even though Aku grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Aku is an entrepreneur. She sells local drinks in Hohoe. Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began two years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their seven children. Aku has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her product. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase more drinks to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aku wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more drinks for resale

loans.name: Luz De Luna Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LUZ DE LUNA”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Alicia es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de papas fritas, venta de fruta, venta de repuestos, venta de molde de repostería, producción de papas fritas, venta de dulces, venta de productos de belleza, venta de chantilin.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Alicia es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción y venta de papas fritas; este negocio lo emprendió hace un año por iniciativa propia, ya que anteriormente trabajaba ayudando a sus padres a realizar estos productos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de aceites por galones) que adquirirá de las empresas distribuidoras y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para su familia ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la atención en salud y las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
The “LUZ DE LUNA”  (Moonlight) community bank are starting their third loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Collpani regional office.  This group has nine members and is run by a board of directors which has Alicia as its secretary.  The businesses that the members of the bank are engaged in are varied and include: selling French fries, selling fruit, selling spare parts, selling confectionery molds, producing French fries, selling sweet treats, selling beauty products and selling chantilly cream desserts.

The loan will benefit this group of small micro-businesswomen, of which Alicia is a member.  Alicia says that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago through an invite from a friend who was an existing member of the institution.  She currently has a business producing and selling French fries.  She started this business a year ago on her own initiative.  In the past, she worked helping her parents make these products.

Alicia will use this loan to increase her capital.  She will buy oil by the gallon from suppliers and then, after making her products, she will sell them from her sales location.  This work allows her to make income for her family.  Alicia is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Alicia replied that she likes the health services and the training sessions.

loans.use: to buy oil by the gallon

loans.name: Walter

texts.es: Walter tiene 34 años y vive con su esposa en una casa construida a base de adobe.Se dedica a la  agricultura porque desde muy niño creció en el campo junto a sus padres a quienes apoyaba en tareas menores cultivando cacao y café para obtener ganancias y mantenerse económicamente.Cuando creció empezó a trabajar mucho porque tenía una familia y necesitaba salir adelante y por eso sus padres decidieron ayudarlo regalándole una pequeña parcela con plantaciones de cacao que le sirvió mucho para empezar independientemente.Actualmente cuenta con una hectárea de cultivo en donde también tiene árboles frutales. Para mejorar la calidad de sus productos suele usar abono orgánico porque considera que usar fertilizantes artificiales deteriora la calidad de sus suelos a largo plazo.Cuando es tiempo de cosechar sus productos convoca trabajadores del lugar para posteriormente secar los granos de cacao extraídos y venderlo a los compradores de la zona esperando recuperar el dinero que invirtió y también obtener ganancias adicionales. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante. En esta ocasión desea solicitar 1,000 nuevos soles para contratar trabajadores del lugar  y retirar la maleza de sus terrenos de cultivo.
texts.en: Water is 24 years old and lives with his wife in a house made of adobe. He is in agriculture for a living because as a child he grew up in the countryside together with his parents who relied on him for small tasks cultivating cocoa and coffee to obtain income and maintain themselves economically. When he grew up, he began to work a lot because he had a family and needed to get ahead in life. His parents decided to help him, gifting him a small plot of land with fields of cocoa that helped him start independently. Today he says he has a hectare of crops where he also has fruit trees. To improve the quality of his products he usually uses organic fertilizer because he thinks using artificial fertilizers deteriorates the quality of his soil. When it is time to harvest his products he hires site workers to then dry the extracted cocoa beans and sell it to the buyers of the zone, hoping to recuperate the money that he invested and also to obtain additional income. This is his first loan with Kiva and is very grateful for the financial support that he is receiveing to continue getting ahead in life. On this occasion, he would like to request 1,000 nuevos soles to contract on-site workers and remove the weeds from his farmland.

loans.use: to hire workers on site.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda  tiene 51 años, es una mujer divorciada y cuido a sus hijos sola hasta lograr que sean personas mayores y responsables. Vive en una casa hecha con bloques de adobe.Yolanda se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 40 años razón por la cual cultiva cacao, café y otros productos rentables de su zona.Actualmente sus parcelas están llenas de árboles cacaoteros y lo mantiene en buen estado gracias a la ayuda de algunos trabajadores del lugar.Actualemnte desea retirar varios árboles de cacao que están desfasados para comprar plantones nuevos y no desperdiciar parte de sus terrenos de cultivo en la próxima campaña agrícola.Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero brindado ya que le permite seguir adelante con su actividad agrícola.En esta ocasión desea solicitar 500 nuevos soles para comprar árboles de cacao y reemplazar los árboles desfasados.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 51, is a divorced woman and she raised her children alone until they became responsible adults.  She lives in a house made of adobe bricks.  Yolanda has worked in agriculture for 40 years; she grows cocoa beans, coffee and other products that are profitable in her zone.  Her parcels are currently full of cocoa bean trees that she keeps in good condition thanks to help from local day laborers.  She currently wants to remove some of the cocoa bean trees that are no longer producing and replace them with new seedlings in order not to waste any of her farmland in the next growing cycle.

This is her second Kiva loan and she feels grateful for the financial support provided because it helps her continue with her work.  On this occasion she wants to ask for 500 new soles to buy cocoa bean trees to replace the ones that are no longer producing.

loans.use: to buy cocoa bean trees.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa construida a base de adobe.Hace 3 años uso el dinero que ahorró trabajando en el campo y puso una tienda en donde vende insumos para la agricultura como abono orgánico y polvos contra las plagas más perjudiciales de su zona.Decidió involucrarse en este negocio porque en su localidad no hay muchas tiendas similares y eso le permite tener buenas ventas para mantener a su familia. Le agrada mucho su trabajo porque a la vez puede atender a sus hijos sin salir de casa.Cuando necesita más mercadería debe solicitarlo a sus proveedores quienes viven en una ciudad muy cercana a la suya.Su principal objetivo es ampliar su negocio con más variedad de productos y a la vez reemplazar los bloques de adobe de su vivienda por ladrillos y cemento. En esta ocasión desea solicitar 2,000 nuevos soles para abastecer su negocio con la compra de abono orgánico para su negocio.
texts.en: Adela, 34, is married and has three children she lives with in a house built of adobe.  Three years ago she used money she’d saved working in the fields and opened a store to sell farm supplies like organic manure and anti-pest powder for the most damaging pests in her zone.  She decided to go into this business because there aren’t many similar stores in her area and this allows her to have good sales to support her family.  She likes her work very much because she doesn’t have to leave home and can care for her children.  When she needs merchandise she has to request it from suppliers that live in a city very near her own.  Her main objective is to expand the business with more variety of products and at the same time replace the adobe in her house with bricks and cement.  On this occasion she wants to ask for 2,000 new soles to stock her store purchasing organic manure for it.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia tiene 38 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos en su casa construida a base de adobe. Alicia se dedica a la agricultura razón por la cual siembre cacao y cafe orgánico , su trabajo diario consiste en mantener en buen estado sus terrenos de cultivo para solventar los gastos de su hogar con la venta de los productos que obtiene además cría gallos y gallinas. Trabaja prácticamente todo el año con ayuda de su esposo y contratando trabajadores del lugar para disminuir la carga laboral. Parte de su labor diaria es también  brindarle un buen cuidado a sus aves porque según comenta deben ser alimentados y aseados de la manera adecuada para luego ser vendidos en diferentes ferias y mercados. Posee dos mini criaderos de gallos  en su casa de campo cerca de sus terrenos y otra en su casa ubicada en el pueblo. De esta manera logra tambien mantener económicamente  a su familia y espera usar el dinero que viene ahorrando en mejorar su vivienda reemplazando los bloques de adobe por ladrillos y cemento.En está oportunidad desea contar con 3,000 nuevos soles para mejorar el ambiente de sus galpones con al compra de mallas metálicas y listones de madera.
texts.en:
Alicia, 38, lives with her husband and three children in an adobe house.  Alicia works in agriculture and has always grown cocoa beans and organic coffee.  Her daily work consists in keeping her farmland in good condition in order to cover household expenses with the sale of products she grows; she also raises roosters and chickens.  She works almost all year with help from her husband and hiring local day laborers to help ease the chores.  

Part of her daily chores is also to care well for her fowl because according to what she says they must be fed and cleaned adequately in order to be sold in various street markets and markets.  She own two mini coops for roosters at her country house near her fields and another one in her house in town.  She’s able to support her family this way and hopes to use the money she’s been saving to improve her house replacing the adobe with bricks and cement. On this occasion she wants to have 3,000 new soles to improve the sheds; she will buy metallic mesh and wood slats.

loans.use: to buy metallic mesh and wood slats.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Angela tiene 24 años, vive junto a su esposo y su pequeño hijo en una casa construida a base de adobe. Angela se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles, lleva 4 años en su negocio y puede dedicarse a está actividad sin descuidar a su pequeño hijo.Ofrece a sus clientes algunos productos tales como arroz, azúcar, leche, entre otros, además de productos de limpieza y pequeños artículos comerciales entre sus consumidores.Suele comprar sus productos al por mayor para obtenerlos a bajos precio y mantener su negocio abastecido por más tiempo.
Su negocio está ubicado en el primer piso de su vivienda el cual lo habilitó con ayuda de su esposo para desempeñar su labor. Uno de sus principales objetivos es trabajar con la motivación que la caracteriza para construir su vivienda a base de ladrillos y cemento para luego ampliar su negocio para incrementar sus ganancias.En esta ocasión desea contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para comprar sacos de arroz, azúcar, fideos, bebidas y otros productos que son solicitados en su zona.
texts.en:
Ángela, 24, lives with her husband and little boy in an adobe house.  Ángela she works selling food products and has been in business four years; she’s able to do business while caring for her little son.  She offers her customers such things as rice, sugar and milk, among others, as well as cleaning supplies and small commercial items among her consumers.
