texts.en: Musarrat is a 57-year-old married woman. She has been in a beauty parlor business for two years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hairstyling and facials. Over time, she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. She needs to deal with more customers time after time. For this, she requires hair care products and skin products with packs of hair rollers and combs, so she applied for a loan of 30,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR)  through Kashf Foundation. She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move in a positive direction as a result of this loan investment.

loans.use: to buy hair care products and skin products with packs of hair rollers and combs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials for finishing his family residential house.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is 36 years old, and she is already skilled and devoted to her work as a farmer, who manages agriculture well. Her farm is not very rich and the income from it is not big, but due to Marine’s care and hard work it yields income for her family. She keeps on her farm now six cows, six calves, two pigs and ten chickens. Marine also cultivates some vegetables and fruits (tomatoes, cucumbers, onions, apples, and apricots) on the family's own land, but the produce is for family use and not for sale.

Marine lives in the village Noratus, which is in the area of Gavar. She is married and has two school-aged children. Her husband works as a builder, but he tries to help Marine around their farm, also. Marine is sure that she can enlarge their farm and earn greater profit from it. For that purpose, she asks a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams (AMD). She will use the loan to buy two cows, ten chickens, and a lot of fodder for her farm animals. It is Marine’s first deal with Kiva lenders, and she expects good results.

loans.use: to buy two cows, ten chickens, and a lot of fodder for her farm animals.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a married woman and a mother of seven children. Her husband is working for daily wages, and his income is not enough to support his family. That is why Kousar is running her own business, producing and selling milk, to contribute to the family income. Over time, Kousar has become famous in her area for providing good-quality milk.

To get an increase in the production capacity of milk, Kousar is requesting a loan of Rs. 30,000 through Kashf Foundation. She will use the loan to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan, and she plans to spend her profits on expanding her business further.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo for milk production.

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
This is Luis. His previous loan was a big help in his business. As of now, he is more focused in attending to his coin-operated water dispenser business as well as in his computer shop. He and his wife continue to work to provide for their family.

He would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan that he will use to pay for the maintenance of his water dispenser and computers. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain the family's daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Luis dreams of having a big place for his business and hopes that his children will finish their studies. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his coin-operated water dispenser and computers.

loans.name: Jamali

texts.en: Jamil is a 35-year-old hardworking man with 2 children living in Fort Portal Uganda. His main business is rental houses, as well as transport to boost his income. He faces challenges of increased competition from other landlords and failure of tenants to pay on time, while his dreams are educating his children to higher levels of learning and owning a housing estate. Jamil is requesting a loan to buy iron sheets for construction.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets for construction.

loans.name: Ratanak

texts.en: Ratanak is a single young man residing in Battambang Province's Ek Phnom district in Cambodia. He lives in a family consisting of seven members including him and his mother who sell vegetables and meats for family income, as the breadwinners in the family. Now, he has his own job at a local NGO (Non-profit Organization) and receives a decent income to support the family. Ratanak wants to pursue his master's degree specializing in Tourism at a local university. Therefore, he applied for his first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) in order to pay his tuition fee. He hopes that this loan will relieve his financial burden so that he can pay more attention to his studies and get a good job to support his family.

loans.use: To pay his tuition fee

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen, age 30, is a married woman. She is running a general store with the support of her husband. The man shown in the photo is Nasreen’s husband. They sell milk with other items of daily use, such as biscuits, rusks, etc., in their store. They have been doing this business together for the past five years and earn enough income to cover their household expenses. To meet the demands of her customers, Nasreen applied for another loan of 30,000 Pakistani rupees. This loan will help her to purchase more cans for storage of milk and some packs of biscuits and rusks. She is in her second loan and has shown good repayment behavior. Nasreen dreams of providing quality education to her four children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase more cans for storage of milk and some packs of biscuits and rusks.

loans.name: Sah 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SAH 2 est composé de neuf personnes qui sont des cohabitantes. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Émilie celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 66 ans. Émilie n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Émilie est mariée à un certain Valentin. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et un à leur charge. Émilie vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges familiales. Afin de faire face aux diverses charges du ménage, Émilie vend des boissons et de l'eau glacée (pure water) depuis une dizaine d’années. Émilie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Émilie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SAH 2, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The SAH2 group consists of nine women who live in the same house. The group's representative, named Émilie, is 66 years old. She is the woman raising her hand in the photo.

Émilie did not attend school. She is married to a man named Valentin with whom she has three children. Some of the couple's children are in school and one is their dependent. Émilie lives with her husband and her children and jointly takes care of the household expenses with her husband.

In order to cover the various expenses of the family, Émilie has been selling drinks and frozen water (Pure Water), for about 15 years. She buys her goods at a market located in Benin.

Eager to satisfy the needs of her customers and to increase her turnover and income, she is requesting a second loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the SAH 2 group. Their previous loan was duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy drinks.

loans.name: Azeeman

texts.en:
Azeeman is 52 years old and a widow. For the past three years, she has been manufacturing ‘waan’ -- ropes, or straps, made from a dried, long, grassy plant. 'Waan' are used for many purposes, including making beds (combined with wooden frames on four legs). She offers various types of ‘waan’ in different colors, and is famous in her community for providing good-quality products.

Azeeman is a single parent of three children and is responsible for fulfilling the basic needs of her children, including food, health care, and education. She is also accountable for improving their standard of living.  She wants to expand her business, so she applied for a loan of Rs. 20,000. She intends to use the loan money to buy another machine for making 'waan' out of good-quality materials, to increase her sales. She wishes to use her increased profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy another machine for making 'waan' out of good-quality materials

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah lives in the Litein area of Kenya. He has four children. He has been farming for 30 years, and his primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, crops, and personal business. He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Milking cows.' His biggest challenge is 'Feeding the animals.' Animals on the farm have been given no names.

Elijah was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'Quick loan processing.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'That the first loan is up to 65,000 [Kenyan shillings].'  His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family,' Elijah replied that he will be able to educate his children.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Elijah owns the following:  cow, poultry, pump, bicycle.  But he does not own:  pig, motorcycle, or automobile.  Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household:  mosquito net, solar power, sewing machine, TV, DVD.  But he does not have:  electricity, or running water.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down."

loans.use: To purchase more dairy cows

loans.name: Annie

texts.fr: Annie est une femme de 37, mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle possède et gère un stand de vente de chaussure dans un quartier de la ville depuis 7 ans. elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter des marchandises afin d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaires et ses bénéfices.les bénéfices ainsi générés vont lui permettre d'agrandir son capital d'une part et d'autre part de subvenir au besoins de sa famille (nutrition, logement, éducation)
texts.en:
Annie is a 37-year-old woman who is married and the mother of two children.  She owns and manages a booth where she sells shoes in one of the neighborhoods of her city.  She has been involved in this activity for the past seven years.

She is requesting a loan to buy some merchandise in order to increase her turnover and profits.  With her profits, she will be able to increase her capital and also to meet the needs of her family (food, lodging, education).

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Rafiqan

texts.en:
Rafiqan is 40 years old and a married woman. She has six children; she is striving hard to meet their needs, including food, clothing and health care.  She started her business of embroidery, to contribute to the family income. She is expert in embroidery and makes beautiful-looking embroidery on cloth. Her customers are based in her community or from nearby areas. At present, she enjoys a great customer list, and her work has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. 

She initiated her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently, she has requested a loan of Rs. 15,000 to buy a stock of thread in different colors, with packs of pearls, sequins and stones, for embellishment. These supplies will help her to meet the orders of her customers, without fail. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children, through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of thread in different colors, with packs of pearls, sequins and stones, for embellishment.

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al Banco Comunal “Amistad Cusqueña”,el socio continua con su negocio de venta de libros y brindando el servicio de taxi,el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio y brindando el serviucio de taxi los cuales le va bien bien gracias al empeño que le pone a cada uno de ellos,el socio es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que el socio sale adelante por su familia.

El socio solicita el credito para la compra de llantas para su carro.
El socio se siente agradecido por el credito otorgado y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y agradece por la ayuda brindada
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Amistad Cusqueña” communal bank. He is continuing with his business selling books and with his taxi service. He has been in his business and offering the taxi  service for some time. These activities are going well thanks to the effort he puts into each one of them. The member is a responsible and hard-working person, as this is how he keeps going for the sake of his family. 

He is requesting the loan to buy tires for his taxi. Member feels grateful for the loan granted and promises to pay his installments on time. He is grateful for the assistance he has been provided.

loans.use: To buy tires for his taxi.

loans.name: Dukore I Group

texts.fr:
Jean fait partie du groupe  Dukore I et   habite à Gitega. Il a   35 ans et est marié à Nadine, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont  3 enfants dont 2 étudient.
Il a sous sa charge une jeune fille.

Il fait le commerce de boutique (riz et haricot)  depuis 16 ans. 

Il  est à son  dix-huitième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité d’articles de sa boutique (haricot, riz) à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait construire une maison  en ville.
texts.en:
Jean is a member of the Dukore I group and he lives in Gitega.  He is 35 years old and married to Nadine, a farmer.  Jean and Nadine have three children, two of whom are in school.  He also supports a young girl.

Jean has been selling grocery products (rice and beans) for the past 16 years.

He is on his eighteenth loan with Turame.  With this loan, financed by Kiva, he will increase his capital and buy a large quantity of grocery products (beans, rice) for resale, in order to make more money.  In the coming years, he would like to build a house in the city.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of grocery products (beans, rice) for resale.

loans.name: Banguka I Group

texts.fr:
Floride fait partie du groupe Banguka I et   habite à Gitaga. C’est une veuve de  38 ans. Elle  a 3 enfants âgés de 5  à 14 ans, dont 2 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de banane et de farine   depuis 10 ans. 

Elle  est à son  treizième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de bananes et de farine à revendre, pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Floride is a member of the Banguka I group and she lives in Gitega.  She is a 38-year-old widow with three children between the ages of 14 and 5.  Two of her children are in school.

She has been selling bananas and flour for the past ten years.

She is on her 13th loan with Turame.  With this loan, financed by Kiva, she will increase her capital and buy a large quantity of bananas and flour for resale, in order to make more money.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of bananas and flour for resale.

loans.name: Vilma Esperanza

texts.es:
Vilma, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque necesita mas capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio; este le permitirá comprar vigésimos de diversas series.
El efecto que tuvo con el crédito anterior fue de mucha ayuda, ya que logro obtener mayores  ganancias y asimismo la clientela  aumento; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado.
texts.en:
Vilma needs to apply for another loan because she needs more working capital to continue investing in her business. This loan will be used to purchase various types of lottery tickets. 

The last loan proved to be a great help, as she was able to increase her earnings as well as her customer base. This has improved her economic conditions and the family circumstances.

loans.use: purchase a variety of lottery tickets.

loans.name: Nazik

texts.en:
Nazik has been raising apricot, peach and pear trees for more than 10 years and supports her family with the profit from her farming. Nazik works hard to sustain her family of six: Nazik, her parents-in-law, her husband and her two children.

As the agricultural income is hardly enough to cover the family's daily costs, Nazik also works as a nurse and provides medical services to her co-villagers. With the earnings she gets, she manages to pay her household expenses. Nazik is requesting a loan so that she can buy the supplies she needs such as fertilizers, seeds, and other things. These will help Nazik to have a good harvest and obtain better profits to provide her family with better financial stability.The other part of the loan will be used for the renovation of the greenhouse. This is very important for Nazik to enlarge the cultivation of fruits and vegetables and gather more income.

Nazik is sure that this loan is a first step to her future success. She dreams of providing her children a beautiful life, a good education, food and clothing.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizer and renovation of her greenhouse

loans.name: Unidos Por Un Peru Group

texts.es: Este es el nuevo grupo “Unidos Por Un Perú” y está conformada por 05 socios entusiastas de comenzar a trabajar. Lily es la que preside al grupo, pues fue elegida por sus compañeros. Actualmente  se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, la cual lo realiza a pedidos. Como actividad segundaria ofrece productos de belleza, obteniendo un ingreso extra para su hogar. Se siente  feliz pues gracias a su esfuerzo ha podido mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de prenda de vestir como chompas, pantalones, casacas y así tener que ofrecer a sus clientes. Su mayor deseo es de instalar una boutique donde pueda ofrecer sus productos. Lily tiene 30 años es separada con 02 aún dependientes. El nuevo grupo “Unidos Por Un Perú” agradecen el crédito brindado. Lily es la tercera del lado izquierdo y viste polo color celeste.
texts.en:
This is the new group "Unidos Por Un Perú," and it is made up of five members who are excited to start working. Lily was elected to preside over the group. Currently she works selling clothing items, which she does to order. As a secondary service she offers beauty items, thereby earning extra income for the household. She is happy that, thanks to her hard work, she has been able to improve her family's quality of life. She applied for this loan in order to purchase clothing items such as sweaters, trousers, and jackets to offer to her customers. Her biggest goal is to set up a store from which to sell her products. 

Lily is 30 years old, she is separated, and has two dependent children. In the picture above, Lily is the third from the left in the blue shirt. 
The group "Unidos Por Un Perú" is grateful for the offer of a loan.

loans.use: purchase sweaters, trousers, and jackets.

loans.name: Agrace

texts.en: Agrace is 42 years old and married with three children, all of whom attend school. She acquired a loan of UGX 3,000,000 to buy mulch for her banana and pineapple plantations. She has a banana plantation and grows pineapples at Kasozi. She has a retail shop business where she gets some additional income. Her business started in 1990 with challenges but as of now, it has stabilized and she can get an income to support her family and pay school fees for her children at the university. Her clients are people from both the village and the town. She hopes to expand her business to meet the ever-growing market for the products. She is a committed woman, hardworking and social. She thanks the bank for the continuous support they have given her to increase her business and sustain the family.

loans.use: To buy mulch and organic manure

loans.name: Radik

texts.en:
Radik successfully manages agriculture. He has a very big private land and he is specialized in potato cultivating. Radik and his family live in the village Zovaber in the area of Gegharkunik. He is married and has three sons. Radik’s parents also live with him; his mother is retired.

Radik has higher education; he is an engineer. Radik’s father is also an engineer, and both of them work in the same place on their specialty. Like many families, their salary and income is not enough for their big family. So Radik has decided to enlarge his potato cultivation, and he asks a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams to buy a lot of potato seedlings and fertilizer for his cultivation activities.

loans.use: To buy a lot of potato seedlings and fertilizer for his cultivation activities.
